info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued March 15 at 8:53AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The Idaho Panhandle Avalanche Center in Sandpoint has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING for the following areas: Boundary and Bonner counties in the Idaho Panhandle. * WHAT...The avalanche danger for the warning area will rise to High today, Tuesday, March 15th. * WHERE...Boundary and Bonner counties in the Idaho Panhandle. * WHEN...In effect from Tue 07:00 PDT to Wed 07:00 PDT. * IMPACTS...Heavy snowfall and wind will create widespread areas of unstable snow at elevations above 5,000`. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions will develop through the day today. Avoid travel in all avalanche terrain, including steep slopes and flatter terrain below them, at upper elevations. Avalanches could be large and may run into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.idahopanhandleavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
